text:
Ivanti(ISeC) is great. If your goal is to patch Ivanti beats everyone out of the
park. Did you truly embrace all of its features? At my previous shop we demo’d
everything from sccm to manage engine; big fix, Tami I’m, solarwinds, too many
to remember. Money wasn’t an issue. Ivanti was the best and had the best
support. They took a client-server architecture approach which makes for a
responsive console. There are a nuances but let me tell you the exact words my
ciso said when management wanted to implement sccm thinking it would fix all of
our problem. “Garbage in garbage out” 
If Ivanti didn’t fulfill your patching request it was due to lack of product use
or the lack of support from the business. Meaning, maintenance windows, fallout
resulting in halting patching, etc. 
Is there another agentless tool out there that patches vm templates and has an
easy and responsive UI.. good luck finding one. If ISeC doesn’t have any
security flaws like the other products, who cares. Make a case about
successfully patching.

metadata.subject: Re: [patchmanagement] If not Ivanti, what?
metadata.email_text_original:
You don't often get email from rperezcorona@gmail.com. Learn why this is
important [https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification]
